title: Hollyoaks’ Jake Quickenden offers to strip to stay on the show
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Hollyoaks star Jake Quickenden has admitted he’s willing to do anything to return to the soap – including stripping.

The 31-year-old made his debut on the Channel 4 soap this week as Woody, a cheeky builder enlisted to work on Cindy’s (Stephanie Warren) new restaurant.

Viewers got very acquainted with Woody pretty quickly as he was introduced mostly topless while getting to work on Cindy’s latest project, Grande Bizarre.

If Jake gets his way, he’ll be spending a lot more time in the village even if it means he’ll have to lose his clothes again.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Pleading for his character’s return, Woody said on Good Morning Britain: ‘If they keep me in the show I’ll do anything. So I will strip.’

Kate Garraway seemed pretty taken by Jake’s soap debut and compared him to Magic Mike, adding: ‘Can I just say, you are building towards some stripping role here. Ben’s not wrong, you’ve got a super slow-mo going on.’

Ben Shepherd wondered: ‘When’s the stripping scene?’ to which Jake teased: ‘Tune into Channel 4.’

Let’s get Woody back on Hollyoaks (Picture: Channel 4)

While he was confident enough to whip his top off, Jake admits he was ‘nervous’ to star in the award-winning soap.

‘So surreal because I’ve done the reality stuff but there’s only so much longevity in that,’ he said.

‘Hollyoaks came to watch and then they offered me this little role. It was really surreal.

‘I was nervous, I was sat at home with my girl and I was terrified because you’re always going to get a bit of grief on Twitter.’

But he added optimistically: ‘I loved it, I said about three things but I was so happy. Working on the show, you see how much hard work goes into it anyway. The cast are all amazing and everyone behind-the-scenes were great. They just made me feel at home.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Hollyoaks airs weekdays on Channel 4 at 6:30pm.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.

description: Hollyoaks star Jake Quickenden has admitted he's willing to strip Magic Mike-style to return as Woody.
